s9vVyvn97SxzxVADEc3CzQ.text: Love this place! The atmosphere is sophisticated and warm, elegant and cozy. Food was awesome! Def a go to spot in Southend.

AdrnSE_7lHHKwUwwFY0kEw.text: Our first visit. Everyone in our group would return (we had 8ppl). The Curry Chicken was tasty and not spicy hot. Pork Chop great. Kale and Brussels salad delicious. Good desserts: liked Banana Foster Cheesecake and Tres Leches best. Not crowded on a Saturday evening (yet). We will return!!

EAytDip5eHM1MhLo670BIg.text: Went with a group of 4, the vibe is great and decor is beautiful. Service and drinks were great, but I had to knock off a star for the quality of food. We all agreed that everything was way too salty, and my food was even burnt. For the prices and overall aesthetics we expected a bit more. Probably will wait until they've settled a little better to give it another try!

CrmKXO0o8A4nhFx58Yci6g.text: Slightly less than OK experience.  The best thing about the place is the scenery. It looks very nice. Service was sub-par. Food was poor quality (tiny egg shells throughout the food).  We asked for biscuits on the side and they substituted it for the potatoes, that's not what we wanted. We wanted both potatoes and biscuits and were willing to pay for it.

DqTl7UIjmJJq8CyN_yb08Q.text: The food was great and the service was on point.  Would definitely come back!   I had the salmon sandwich and fries and would order it again.

JIlgDiJyvqqg_aEf9qKj2A.text: My boyfriend and I sat at the bar for a quick dinner on our anniversary and we picked the perfect spot! The food was fantastic and the staff was so nice!! They gave us an extra slice of delicious peanut butter cake for our occasion:)

D6Bb227p4wS1koWplClzbA.text: Our server, John, was freakin' amazing. He explained everything to us, and was on point with his level of attention. In looking at other reviews, I don't know how anyone can blame a server for bad "ketchup" other "fake" A-1 sauce. Like the servers make this stuff. Service is service, they ate not responsible for what the kitchen or management does. If you blame your server for bad food or drinks, maybe your just a pain in the a$$ customer!

TV5AllQbJVGE3V2Jm3RNCg.text: I could not love this spot more! Everything about it from the menu with many different options, the quality of food, the drink selection, beautiful decor and amazing staff. Even on a random week night, you walk in and know you are going to end up enjoying your night out! I have absolutely no complaints and recommend that you try The Manchester next chance you get! Ask for Lauren to wait on you because she will make your night & don't forget to ask Mike to make you something to drink, you won't be sorry!

G52fDlR6Ckin2CZxK8XTAQ.text: Bishops Chicken was really good. Old Fashioned was served with almost no ice because it sat at the waiters station too long. Had to remind the waitress that we were waiting on drinks.   Manchester atmosphere was ehhhh. Basically, Liberty with some minor tweaks. They missed the mark here.   $14 for a Bulleit (Rye) Old Fashioned seemed a bit excessive, especially when you can get the same drink at Barcelona with Few Bourbon for basically the same price.   Downstairs speakeasy had a great atmosphere and the Smoked Old Fashioned was good. However, after waiting for over 20 minutes to attempt to get a 2nd drink, we left.

bNgxY2xYcna-kQufIuGv_A.text: I highly would recommend going anywhere but this restaurant. We made reservations for a Saturday night. The restaurant was not crowded. We sat down at the table to wait for 10 minutes before our server got to us. We had to ask for her as well. She was not pleasant in the slightest bit. My husband, mother and I all ordered martinis. When we finally got them, they were in wine glasses because they "didn't have enough". When my husband complained about this to the manager, he brought back the martini in a dirty martini glass and my husband's drink looked cloudy, not clear. We ordered apps - the shrimp and cheese plate. Both were not up to par compared to how overpriced they were. We decided to get the check and go somewhere else due to poor service and food. The manager knew we were upset with our experience and did not comp one item off the menu-even the martini we did not drink. I will never go back here or recommend it to anyone. Horrible experience.

vH8k_Epj6WWsCAUFIKc7CQ.text: Went to the cool speakeasy bar downstairs with my friend for a couple drinks. The bartender, Mike, made me a delicious drink and was very personable. The overall vibe of the place is really cool and a welcome change of scene to Southend.

L5NykC3vJ4MQtcyStIkPyw.text: Arrived and there weren't even10 people in the restaurant at 6:45 on a Saturday. Waited at least 10 minutes before a waitress came to our table. Ordered a glass of Brut and they were out of it so they just brought me a different wine and never asked me what I'd actually like. By 7:15 the place was still fairly empty. That should be a huge red flag. We won't return.

PlcuulLLwIT40uOMrzMJkw.text: open by young group of yuppies don't know what to do with grandpa's money.. food is mediocre very deceiving menu..extremely high prices...location is great hot women do eat there but again you're this you coming to eat you will be disappointed food is not good at all I wouldn't waste my time here..to many other spots to eat

M7GOo_Mi537w0s_Jg5YcUQ.text: False advertising. This is 100% a wanna be night club. Loud music thumping, people crammed into the tight space, and yes... bottle service... this place missed the mark and should have just called itself what it is: Charlotte's next 20-something's hang out. This is absolutely not a speakeasy.

Y3PjPggI9mrbaFuAKd6Qgg.text: This is a wanna be night club masquerading as a speakeasy. DJ on the weekends? Why? Just doesn't make senses and the atmosphere it's trying to be doesn't work. Go inside and there's a bunch of folks treating it as a night club. Nope. Really disappointed and won't be going back. When you decide to be an actual speakeasy let us know then we'll consider giving it another shot.

r2l-dRwGSyGtvQJEgElKGQ.text: The speakeasy bar is the most atrocious place I have ever visited. The bartender cursed at my friend because she accidentally spilled a drink and broke a glass. They were incredibly rude calling my friends I intoxicated when we weren't. I will never return here. My friend touched this mallet that was on the bar and was accused of being too drunk. We have all had one drink. The atmosphere in this bar is truly very terrible. Never coming back. Change your attitude.

gQ-6NExflbaQD5AoJZ2QyA.text: The Manchester is a very nice restaurant with a good variety of entree choices. The bar area is very nicely decorated and the after dinner experience of going downstairs to the "Speak Easy" was a unique way to Top OFF the night!

GKR4a6lDszaYdcnlnjhBow.text: Loved the ambiance of this place! I think it takes you back in time. The drinks are great, just a little pricey. Make sure you know the password!

Lj_dMxYRFN8yo2JeSDWoVw.text: A+ in the atmosphere department. A "hidden" door leads you downstairs to a dimly lit basement speakeasy complete with bartenders in flapper apparel. Heavy-handed on the drinks (which is always a good look in my opinion), Jazz playing in the background, the scent of the smoker used for their smoked spirits- the vibe is set from the moment you enter. Avoid the Margarita Cansino (the Rita Hayworth nod is lit) unless you absolutely love the flavor of agave spirit. The sazerac still has me buzzed hours later. If the bartenders were just a bit more attentive, and the kitchen had later hours, this would be a 5 star for me.

bLW2yENQ1un6sNkAEWSN3g.text: Loved everything we ordered! Absolutely superb. Service was great as well. We will be back! Brussel sprouts and deviled eggs should not be missed.

TdYqj_7UlmZA2DbPdq-0PA.text: Not sure when I have ever paid almost $100 for such bad service.   Our food came out so fast we didn't even have time to breath or enjoy our drinks. Then our waitress disappeared for 25 minutes.   We had to wait 25 minutes to pay! That is nuts.   My salad was good but my husband wedge was full of core.   He got tired of picking around it.  What a waste of a date night and 98 bucks.

tjsZYitmFMlvuUdCG2H8Iw.text: The environment was cool. The servers seemed a bit preoccupied with conversation at another table and left us waiting a couple times. We got some sandwiches and a couple items off the happy hour menu. Happy Hour is proved great, but the spinach artichoke dip was pretty weird and the chicken shawarma sandwich was not so good.

CPLCoc854P2NG-kIUFsK9w.text: Super cute atmosphere for girls night and date night and the food was awesome! Some of the drinks we ordered weren't the best so we had to take them back in exchange for a simple mixed drink. The speak easy was downstairs but they hadn't quite perfected the influx of people wanting to enter downstairs. The manager was excellent and let us down because we were celebrating a birthday. Once we got down there, the music was great but the lines at the bar were very long for a drink. I'll definitely come back once they fix some minor tweaks. Over all it's a great place to check out!

kf9rcO36X8IFbyo3BTpvJg.text: This place is awesome! The food, ambiance, decor is superb. The entire staff was amazing and extremely helpful. This is a very chill spot with just enough noise but not too much. I ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp with a Greek salad and it was delicious! The bartender made our drinks perfect! I would highly recommend this for date night, birthdays, or girls/guys night out!

qZSp4Dw3p1s5zPlfXw83_Q.text: I reluctantly went out on a Friday night for dinner to this new place in Southend. As is par for the course, the place was packed with young people with way to much money. We were told it would be a 30 min wait. We went to the bar where we had a "real martini" in a real martini glasses. 3 for $40. We didn't get seated until we had been waiting for over an hour. Once seated we had a great table. I had seen several charcuterie boards pass by that looked delicious. I decided to order one for dinner and split it with a friend. When it came to the table it was piled high with delious cheeses and meats. More than plenty for 2 people. Cost ..$21. A bargain for what we got. Had a great glass of wine in a 'real wine glass" real meaning great glass with a generous pour. All in all everything but the wait as great. I'll be back when the newness wares down. Give it a try, lots of pretty people to look at. Oh, I forgot, our server was great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States

eeWCdU3vQnwZsI5-gzbO_w.text: The restaurant is fun and vibrant. The food was very good and the service was amazing.

5w5fojOhXoN4M6j4JfgBXQ.text: The whole experience my wife and I had the day we tried The Manchester was not very good at all. We decided to stop in and grab a snack and a drink last weekend, our waitress was very "out there". She either had a long night and dint get much sleep or she was really stoned... We asked what the soup of the day was, she then walked around aimlessly for 5 minutes then went into the kitchen for another 5 minutes... Only to come back and ask us if we had any questions or if we were ready to order... Well we would still like to know what the soup is...  She made her way back to kitchen and came back to tell us the soup of the day was a potato soup, I then asked if it had bacon pieces in it and she replied no it did not. Well it did have bacon in it (I love bacon but if you dont eat pork for any number of reasons you may be upset if it comes to you containing that magically delicious meat) ... I ordered a beer and my wife ordered an Irish coffee because it was so cold inside, our waitress then asks my wife what she would like her Irish coffee made with... come on it's not that hard, the bartender supposedly knew how to make one... She came back with hot black coffee with a single shot of Jameson in it... no baileys or creme or sugar... Every other word that came out of this girls mouth was "For sure"  We recieved our check and I was blown away at how expensive it was... a single shot of Jameson is $13 here!!! Another 10 bucks and you can buy a bottle!! Our tab was over $45 for 1 beer, 1 horrible excuse for an Irish coffee, and 2 small cups of soup...  I won't be coming back here, this place was a joke...

cCxj20LPQT4LuOsiq22Z0g.text: So I dropped into the new Speakeasy called "1812" last night at the Manchester .. I've been extremely lucky in my travels and have visited speakeasies all over the states and some over in Europe ..  I can't think of a single one of them that has anything on the one I checked out last night. The furniture .. lighting .. the music .. the old timey movies on their hi-def flatscreens .. even the barkeeps and their 1920's attire made for a really great first time experience there .. Loren & Mike are seasoned professional mixologists behind the bar with no shame in their game making proper Old Fashions. If you want to go back in time and enjoy the overall vibe I can't think of a better place to go than "1812" .. now if I could only remember the password ??? Ha

I0nVrN931cq01_-j8rU2SQ.text: Food was good. The wedge salad is huge...practically an entire head of iceberg. Lobster Mac and cheese was incredible! I did however expect a step up on quality and presentation for the very high menu prices. Decor and vibe are fun and inviting.

hRpuU_MLg-FXHDrkbCMg1g.text: I hope their food is better than their manner on the telephone. I just called them to ask if they had a menu on the internet. The very unfriendly person on the phone said in an exasperated voice, "We do not!" I was surprised. Then she said, "You can come in and read the menu here." LOL  I wasn't ready to give up so I asked, do you have any specials you could tell me about. The response, "No!"

tVboLCKJW2nJS2IDCcbLCA.text: After reading previous reviews, I guess I wouldn't recommend going in the after hours time. This place definitely would not be a good night club location. However, I would highly met recommend going earlier in the night I was there around 10 to 11 on a Wednesday and it was awesome!!! Exactly what they advertise it as definitely a speakeasy with great prohibition themed drinks and an awesome menu that describes where the drink originated. You feel like you've been transported back to the 1920's. Comfortable seating and great 1920's themed music. Definitely recommend for an after dinner drink.

E5fSxZJ9Xh5IMVpRdkPgPQ.text: Needs work on the details. Getting water/drinks out to customers. Listening to what the customer is requesting when ordering. We liked the inside decor quite a bit. The rice on the menu is legit! I would wait a couple months for them to iron out the details and then try it out.

znjy8lhUZu65ret4IAhtVw.text: Came here for Fathers Day. Made a reservation the day before to be sat outside since we brought a dog, which I thought was great that they are ok with. Got there, waited an hour ten to be seated, though they had empty tables on the patio, were sat then waited another 30 minutes to have waters brought to our table. One of the Dad's let the waitress know about the terrible service so far, and then a manager came out to apologize letting us know they had 4 waitstaff call out, which is understandable, it's not like we had the option to go anywhere else at that point. I wonder if anything would have been said if he didn't complain. They had a mimosa special which was great, the manager comped our first round which was much appreciated. The food was decent, a few people got the chicken and cornbread waffles, decent, a little dry on the waffle. The salads were great, chicken pesto paninis with Manchester sauce also decent. I've been here before for dinner as well and we loved the wings, Mac and cheese, shrimp, rice. What I didn't understand was that, even after having staff being out, they still had every single time slot open on opentable, and we saw parties coming in while were eating that were just sitting there waiting just as long or longer than us. You'd think that if you didn't have the staff you'd adjust the reservations you're taking so you don't ruin people father's day meals with ridiculous waits? Stars for the dog friendly patio, manager eventually apologizing, decent food (primarily dinner not the brunch we had).

u7Cs_pYNZXh_PkmFVISJZA.text: I met a friend here for dinner. They have $5 appetizer specials for happy hour. We enjoyed the hummus and brussel sprouts. Saving room for dessert, we split the shrimp and lobster risotto. There was no skimping on the shrimp and lobster. We both had an ample portion of food. We planned to have dessert in the speakeasy, but opted to drink our calories. The wait staff, general manager, and bar tender were all super cordial. Definitely enjoyed the dining experience.

OWruy7C21ArgWFxlAK_s3A.text: Tried to enter through the speakeasy door, DIDN'T EVEN GET TO SAY THE PASSWORD (isn't that the point?), they told us to go to the main entrance. Had to wait 10 min then got sent through a "secret" door going downstairs. Don't sit near the cocktail smoke box (it leaks bad). The old fashioned is made for frat boys going out in south end after downing several dozen Busch lattes (aka if you've had a few already, it might taste great). FYI, there's a hidden smoke machine in the Bulleit Bourbon barrel, you know for when they play the club music at 11... in True speakeasy fashion. Pay the extra $10 for a membership at Dot dot dot...BEST OLD FASHIONED IN CHARLOTTE.

MJsOQiQW0xXCdKGnMIhSiA.text: Nice place to get a good sized drink after work.  Really loved the basement area, as well! It has an photo photo! Check it out!

ZXBjqrKCK4TA4sjk86uTXQ.text: Boyfriend and I were walking around South End doing some shopping and decided to stop for lunch. We were expecting generic pub kind of food but were surprised by the nice decor inside and the quality and presentation of our food! Bf got the chicken sandwich and I got a burger and fries. Pretty cheap $12 for each but they were easily one of the best sandwiches we've had locally in town. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for your classic lunches! And there was no wait for us around lunch time!

TMcrSFB0lFCqe0XA0tzvMw.text: I had been excited to try this place as I always liked Essex in Uptown and had been told this was the same owners. I went today with my family and after spending $150 on a lunch for 4, I left feeling unimpressed and incredibly underwhelmed. My husband and I ordered a breakfast boat, when it came the eggs were cold and the potato medley was far from being cooked. I also had the prosciutto and melon as an appetizer and I could have got fresher prosciutto from a grocery store. All in all, we will not be returning and will not be recommending.

HiPdR4gDyHRe9IJcTkeH-Q.text: We had a wonderful meal. The experience was very pleasant. We will be back to visit the speakeasy

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States. Right off the menu,  shrimp and lobster risotto, ribeye steak with an excellent choice of side dishes  The Brussels sprouts were super.

9pmp4QZjXDDcgGsGICtR1g.text: We were excited to try this place, but after our first visit a few weeks ago it's clear we won't be back. The staff was nice but seemed completely overwhelmed, and the place wasn't even that busy. They took 10 mins to have a server come over after being seated, then another one decided to take our order (then our real server was confused about this and had to chase the other one to get our order from her!), drinks (overpriced) took too long to come out... overall a frustrating experience that keeps you wondering when the hell you'll get service instead of enjoying your visit. Food was good but it's basically fancier bar food options, so given the chaotic service, long waiting times and overpriced drinks it's not a place I'd go back to. Plenty of better options in the area.

DEvRqOw96po0XIX628fEDA.text: Mike is the best bar tender ever. Make sure you ask what he can make "off the menu" he is amazing, every drink he made us was so delicious. This is a great venue in Charlotte! Go see Mike for great drinks and an accommodating bartender. Room 1812!

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States

4tAv4B2sC8y6moUU3B--sA.text: Normally don't write these, but feedback is important for cool new spots, but first a disclaimer: We only got there with enough time to experience the "late night" version of this place around 10PM More on that in a sec.  One star for a few reasons:  It took us about 20 minutes to get a drink after getting the attention of a bartender, it wasn't really THAT busy when we got there. Busy, but not any busier than a regular bar right before the rush on a Friday evening, and they didn't have a drink menu (they took olives and wine upstairs and only served generic drinks). Kinda lame... Additionally, the atmosphere was cool, but they tried to turn it into a night club (why?) for the "late" part of the night.  Ill say this: nobody going to this place off of the advertising wanted a club experience. If I wanted to go to a club, I wouldn't go to a speakeasy. The whole experience was just confusing and frustrating. It doesn't work as a night club, it's too small, and the point of having a secret "password protected" lounge is completely lost on the fact that they tried to turn it into a party scene WITH BOTTLE SERVICE(?) Who the heck will pay for that at THIS place? Nobody is there for bottle service...  I wouldn't recommend going here for the club portion of the night, which by the way starts way too early.  I bet it'd be really awesome to go during the speakeasy hours for that nice niche experience, but I won't be back for the night scene. There's places for that scene, and Room 1812 is not it. Way too small for it.

9APDqSMBM2KvyvLp-ep-LA.text: Largely a forgettable place. If you order the prime rib you will get a ribeye and they will swear it is a prime rib but charge you For a ribeye. Wait staff does their best to makeup for errors by the kitchen and bartenders but all parts miss their mark. (Wrong food, watered down cocktails, menu missing allergy components, etc). The speakeasy, Room 1812 ,cocktails are overly expensive and does not celebrate the art of the cocktail. There are at least 3 other speakeasy establishments that have far superior cocktails and highlight unique brands of spirits. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

_vNoUqQg7YSA10wTUs4bDg.text: Came here because there was a 1.5 hour wait but we sat right down here. Really cool photo op at the front. Came for brunch, I got breakfast and my boyfriend got lunch. My mini bagels didn't come with a side, which for the price, was disappointing. Maybe fruit or something. My boyfriends chicken sandwich came with fries. We would have liked a different side but nothing else seemed good. Mike, our server, would get a 2 star review. He would not be hired my me if I was the management based on his performance. Our first time and he was very lackluster. May come back for dinner and give it another shot. Kind of pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States

9QqGx1d1swALSEqR231sVw.text: The ambience is relaxing and upbeat at the same time. A tree with fairy lights in the center of the bar accentuates the leather booths lining the back wall. Front and center is a stage that has amazing music going throughout the week! My favorite thing is to grab two or three appetizers with a couple of drinks throughout the night! Definitely a must hit when in South End!

WooRq9ekxjBY0mSXnA6dLA.text: My girlfriend and I visited this place with 2 friends on Wednesday evening (4/17/19) for appetizers and drinks. The next day my girlfriend and I ended up both having food poisoning. While we were there, we each ordered one drink and a charcuterie board that had meat, cheese, and bread. Upon receiving the board we noticed that it was incredibly difficult to bite into our slices of "bread" and it felt like our teeth were breaking with every bite. We asked our waitress if they had anything softer and she brought us back some toasted pita bread. The next morning we were both ill and throwing up the whole day. We believe that the charcuterie board was either sitting out for too long or that the meat and cheese were not kept at the right temperature to serve to guests.   On top of the food poisoning, Our waitress was having trouble remembering everything we had ordered. She asked our friend if she needed another margarita without bringing her the first one...and also had to ask my girlfriend after putting 2 glasses of wine on our check if she actually ordered 2 glasses or just 1. She had only ordered 1 and sent her back to remove it and bring the new check. Our friends asked what one of the cakes on the menu was like and she responded with "it's cute". Not sure that was the response she was looking for in terms of describing what the dessert was.   Anyways It would have been fine if this was a weekend and they were busy but it was a Wednesday night with an average amount of people in the bar. The bar staff was dressed up in flapper dresses and feathered headbands. It was a little too over the top for me and seemed like this place is trying too hard to be a speakeasy.   Beware of food poisoning if you go here!

NGCaUMSrDlhJO36bj7_Irg.text: Love the photo booth my the front door. Lobster risotto is out of this world. Didn't care for the key lime pie That much. Lamp chops were delicious, definitely big enough to share a plate. Higher price range

3Bxf3ezr05W2GKbIaSE0cA.text: Food was okay and the service was terrible. Waitress came up one time and then when we asked for salt and pepper it took her 10 minutes and she had someone else go get it for her. The place wasn't even packed and it took forever for our food.

DTzXmcaTkzNCGrFBSeNMew.text: I tried this place for brunch yesterday with a girlfriend and it was delicious! The interior decor was lovely and the bar area was buzzing wth the Women's World Cub Finals. GO USA! Plus $5 mimosas and bloody mary's are never a bad idea. The food portions were large and the menu was classic yet inventive.  Our server mentioned there's a speakeasy downstairs so I'm definitely planning to check it out sometime soon. Until next time, Manchester!

XFx0gs-u-lxaNbGASEyMTA.text: Honestly, 1/2 a star sounds more realistic. It wasn't a complete bust.   Not going to get into too much detail.   $14 Bloody Mary that is mostly Zing Zang??  Why??  The deviled eggs were decent.   When a salad is split between 2 people, split it in the back. That prevents the guests from having to waste their time splitting it, and not enjoying their time there.   Why did our entrees arrive before the salads??  Odd, not very English.   $30 "12 oz. Prime" ribeye, ordered MR, that was WD and looked like it was grilled on the grill's cold spot by somebody's 8 year old.   Furthermore, the inability to use 2 very important ingredients in savory cooking. S&P!!  The asparagus was heartbreaking.   The service wasn't any better. I'll save my thumbs and I'll leave it with a surprising, yet unsurprising disappointment.   I can deal with bad service, if the food is prepared  the way it should be and sent out accordingly.   Failed, in both areas. The 1/2 star goes to the deviled eggs and who prepped them. Thank you!  Good luck Manchester!

sJ9jNFmK-9pjfq6jENrcbg.text: So brand new place in south end. It took the place of Liberty. I was walking by and saw it was open and decided to check it out and I was glad I did. They had great options and a great beer list as well. It's a large place so it would have to get really busy to get crowded. For an appetizer the waitress recommended the bacon Brussel sprouts which were excellent. For the main meal I had the braised short rib sandwich. Braised short rib is my fav food and it was pretty good here as well. The only issue was the kitchen doesn't have its timing down as it came out as I was still eating the brussel sprouts. Overall it was an easy 4 stars which could be 5 as they work out the kinks.

Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon brussel sprouts

nzDMTAV9kx_Sbsht9w2Y0w.text: This restaurant has some really great food and drinks! Everything was amazing the doughnut sandwich, grits and shrimp, salmon sandwich, brussel sprouts, deviled eggs and cheeseburger.  We will definitely be back!

yHGlbrPtRXCsHs2aUsHvIQ.text: Manchester's. A new restaurant and bar on South Blvd. This spinach salad with fried goat cheese, beets several kinds of craisins, fried onion strings and I'm absolutely sure Jesus must have made the dressing. dressing. OMG!  Sean the bartender was super sweet. These guys are the best.

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach And fried Feta cheese salad.

mHEd8kotFAovor_kr7XPUA.text: We went here the first week they were open and had a great experience. Our waitress was lovely and fun. We went on a weeknight and were seated immediately. The selfie camera at the front of the restaurant was a fun surprise!  The entrees were a little bit more expensive than we were wanting to spend, so we decided to order a bunch of apps and split them. Great choice! They were big portions and all delicious. Our favorites were the bacon brussels sprouts and firecracker shrimp. I've eaten A LOT of brussels in my lifetime and I'm still dreaming about those. I couldn't believe how many shrimp we got and they were perfectly fried.  The Jalapeno Bacon deviled eggs were decent, but not something I would have to order again. The pretzel twists and beer cheese were yummy, just wish there were more pretzel sticks.  We split the cheapest bottle of red wine (we're classy broads) and our total was ~$30 a person with tip? I felt like it was a pretty good deal and we left decently full. (We intentionally left some room for Jeni's ice cream!)  We will definitely be back and would recommend!

nTwgRVL9M0f1d1R6XmJkxg.text: Best chicken and waffles that I've had. 5 Minute drive from downtown Tiffany has the veggie omelet and gives it a 6

2lkI17qIpT3GnoIof_bh4w.text: I miss the Liberty.  It had better food and better prices.    By no means was the Manchester bad.  I like the space and the fact that it has outdoor seating where I can bring my dog.    I've been there once and left feeling that my dinner was fine.  Not great but reasonably good.  But some of the prices were ludicrous - like $9 for a pint of Wicked Weed Pernicious.

SwwIrl0ZqM_3U_tXo420UQ.text: We had dinner here last night and got right in without a wait around 6:45 (awesome for a Saturday!) We had cocktails, curry chicken and chicken shawarma. Service was quick, food was tasty and the space was clean and not too loud. Nothing we ate blew me away, but for a walkable southend restaurant I definitely want to come back and try more things! As a note, entrees are a bit overpriced IMO. I got a sandwich and fries for half the price of my boyfriends entree and we got the same amount/quality of food

3L0_-_hwncnRljAyVJQmLg.text: Originally was attempting to go to Tupelo Honey (across the parking lot), but after we were told that there was a 1 hr wait, we decided to try out Manchester. To our excitement, Manchester had no wait, and the menu looked pretty good. Based on the decor, this is likely a really nice bar/date spot at night though the ambience felt a little weird for 12:00 on a Sunday. Two words - Lobster Roll - Get it! It was delicious. It came with a side of fries (which were a little to heavily salted), but the lobster roll more than made up for it. Huge chunks of lobster, a buttery roll, and very little filler/mayo. I will definitely be back! By the way, we were done with our meal and halfway home when Tupelo finally texted and said our table was ready....

LSEqM07XGpgcHpgglYLf6A.text: I had made a reservation for 8pm on a Saturday night. I get to the restaurant on time, told the hostesses the name, and they just ignored us and looked at us like we each had 2 heads. My party did not get sat for 20 minutes. When we finally get sat at our tables, no one had given us menus or waters. It took 15 minutes for someone to come by to fill our glasses and we had to ask for our server and menus. Our server came over and apologized, telling us that they all thought someone else had our table. She also sat down at our table to take our orders which was weird. Food was just OK, no one finished their meals. Also kept having to ask for our water glasses to be refilled. I definitely won't come back here.

WxcHlU2zgqnr0jY66FC_OA.text: I came by The Manchester the other night for a few drinks and was blown away. Sean the bartender upstairs helped me pick out a tequila cocktail and an appetizer, I highly recommend the firecracker shrimp. I also was able to go downstairs and check out the speakeasy, Room 1812. Mike was super personable and crafted me a drink that wasn't on the menu based on my own tastes. Definitely be sure to not miss the downstairs and check him out!

Ku1GKgzvwUPDRvI0x33SOg.text: We stopped in on a Wednesday for date night. They offer about 6 different glasses of wine for $5. Their selection was decent. For diner, I had the lamb chops and substituted my side for Manchester rice. The rice was hibachi-ish, very flavorful and had a few vegetables and herbs in it. The lamb chops were large in size but lacked flavorful depth. They were cooked well. The Manchester did not live up to my expectations from following them on Instagram, but I am willing to give them another shot in the future, stay tuned.

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States

LfxRMUszx7FwTvFVJM_RIA.text: Had a great burger with A1. Recommend adding grilled mushrooms and lettuce. Third meal in a row I've enjoyed there.

chtAmdZksb1n8RnpFg0wPA.text: As someone who frequents speakeasies all over the world, this is by far the best speakeasy in Charlotte. The drinks are on par with speakeasies you would find in NYC as are the knowledge of the bartenders. The vibe is dark enough to make you want to stay off your phone, the music is classic 20s Jazz, and they play old black and white movies in the background. They have a bar in the center along with couches lining the room. The servers dress up in True 20s fashion. It really is a valiant effort and a valiant execution of bringing a speakeasy vibe to charlotte that is truly, currently lacking.  Thank you, Room 1812, for stepping this up a knotch, and for making this a real, authentic speakeasy. Keeep it up!   P.S. I spoke with the servers about the "club vibe" that a lot of these reviews mention and they shared that this venue is no longer transferring into a club in order to stay True to their speakeasy patrons. Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States

c3N0BbNGJ2y9Gq_h3D2aug.text: Do you like the idea of paying $40 for an appetizer, a beer, and a Bloody Mary? Do you like paying that amount and then realizing you could have gotten the whole thing at Applebee's instead for roughly half the price and the same generic quality? Do you want to find your food so egregiously overpriced that you'll leave halfway through your meal to find another restaurant? Then head down to the Manchester!   The interior of the place is cute enough. However, it doesn't match with the vibe. The food is British pub style, but the decor resembles a hip sushi place. I guess the fact that almost no one was there during Saturday lunch rush should have clued me in that culinary delights were not in store for me.   I was happy to find one of my favorite local beers on tap. I was less happy that it cost $10. I get that it's a craft beer, but it's also local, and that felt overpriced to me. Our server, though nice enough, inexplicably didn't bring the cocktail menu until we requested it. He also told us we were his second table ever. I wasn't exactly sure what to do with that information. Perhaps, in his own way, he was subtly urging us to turn back. My wife ordered what was essentially a Bloody Mary with tequila--at a $14 price tag. I love Bloody Marys, but this was incredibly bland and average. I would've felt better paying $8 for it.   We decided to get an appetizer while perusing the menu and opted for the spinach and artichoke dip. We received an almost comically small bowl of dip with pita chips. The pita chips were greasy enough to leave residue on your fingers. Yum! The dip was okay. You know what wasn't okay? The fact that it cost $12.   At this point, nothing on the menu looked good enough to justify its price. $19 for fish and chips? $12 for a basic cheeseburger with American cheese? Now, I don't mind spending money on good food. I'll pay $150 for lunch at Hello Sailor without batting an eye. But the prices have to be in line with the quality and style of food. This is cooking for middle America, and it's not worth it. We opted to stop at this point and not order anything else.   I felt better about that decision when an incredibly overpowering fish odor permeated the room all of a sudden. I scanned the menu for the strongest fish. Salmon? No. Fish and chips? No. I'm not sure if something was off, but I wasn't interested in finding out.   Pass on this one. If you're tempted for mediocre bar food, at least go to Applebee's or TGI Friday's because at least you'll save money. And I'm saying that as someone who hates those places.

pKsiJJ9IKxcDPS9A-FSA1A.text: We went early-ish (around 7pm) on a Saturday night, when the vibe was still like a speakeasy (and not a club). At first, the voice in the loudspeaker turned away the group we were standing behind citing an hour wait, but we decided to hang out and see if we could get in anyway. Sure enough, a few minutes later the door opened and some people exited, so we just walked in. There was no one at the door carding people or asking for the password, so we just found seats at the bar and ordered some drinks.   It took a little while to get our drink order taken and each of the drinks seems to take some time to prepare. But they were worth the wait.   The vibe was chill, I think there was a dj spinning lounge-y tracks. The bathrooms are single stalls so I could see how there could be long lines when the place is packed.   There is a staircase you can go up that opens into the Manchester restaurant (it opens up as a secret panel behind the hostess stand). We were starving so we decided to go upstairs and grab some dinner.

ia0CbHK5FG657Bxe5zxnAw.text: Came in on a Saturday night, maybe around 8. The bar area was busy since the Duke game was on. There wasn't a wait on the dining side, so we were able to get seated right away for a table of four. We started off with the spinach dip. It came with warm pita and the dip was in a small cask iron skillet. It was good, nothing out of this world for $12. My friends ordered the shrimp and deviled eggs app. I didn't try them, but they looked good.  I ordered the prime steak and cheese sandwich. The bread was fresh and the sandwich was ok.  I don't mind at all paying for food, but $15 for a sandwich and fries that aren't made in house, just makes me feel like it's not worth it.  Everyone thought their food was good, nothing special. Since the bar area was so busy, it took a while for our drinks to come (wine and old fashions). I was a little confused by the music and the overall theme of the restaurant. I liked the music (90s-2000s hip Hop) but just felt like "what's going on here".  Overall, I don't know if I would come back to eat. I do want to try Room 1812 once it opens and I would grab a drink in the bar area.

rDFrd5htdQLAN461Um9F9w.text: I was so excited to see this space become something new! My family decided to give it a try today. We tried to check the online menu but that wasn't available.   We arrived and asked to sit outside because it was a beautiful day. We sat down and our waitress (Alex) came up very quickly, we had hardly even completely sat down.  We said we would need a moment to settle in and look at the menu... she just stood there... we told her again please give us sometime. Then she comes back in one minute, making ya feel quite rushed. We were still not even close to being ready.   Anyways we finally placed our order and started our wait for the food. When the food arrived I immediately was confused by my $19 fish and chips having one single piece of fish. Also an order at our table had the wrong side and when we told the food runner he was quite bothered and didn't apologize for the mistake.   When our server finally came back I had to ask for ketchup (ALWAYS BRING THAT WHEN PEOPLE HAVE FRIES) and I questioned my portion size. I saw the table next to us have two piece on their fish and chips... but she claimed it was suppose to be one. THAT IS A CRAZY PRICE FOR A SINGLE PIECE OF FREAKING FISH!   I won't be returning to this location because you can't run a restaurant on location and nice decor alone. You have to have good food at a decent value and great service which they didn't have any of.   Save your money and go somewhere else!

9puvDlEOv5JgzpPGKRLuUQ.text: Absolutely blown away by the food here. The short rib sandwich was off the charts and the fries are darn near perfect.   This is located in the old Liberty space and it's amazing what a nice touch up an do. It looks much nicer and the bar area is more inviting and the restaurant area feels much, much nicer.   The service was quick and again, I can't rave enough about the food. The music was fun classic rock and fitting for the lunch time atmosphere while I was in there. Keep an eye on this place and look for them to continue to pick up steam as they iron out the kinks.

F1Nhdecnwvz0He9ZuLr8tA.text: Ok so myself and friends were pumped to go visit this fairly new spot all because we heard of the speak easy that is connected to it . So I'm going to start by saying the staff was super nice  but we were not won over by the food at all everything was blah in our opinions . Now the drinks that's a different story we all enjoyed our drinks and the staff made it fun for us to step into the speak easy it's like a secret wall that you tap into and you enter into what appeared to be a very jazz old school vibe basement it was super cool and that was probably the most enjoyable part of our night there . Once arriving and leaving there is a photo screen op to take photos with yourself and friends and you can have them emailed or text to your phone which I thought was pretty cool . I'd say this spot is good for having drinks or a happy hour type spot .

7iL7F0lIR4ctaGCgWXJMyg.text: We dined here for brunch. It was outstanding. $5 Mimosas and great food. I ordered the Chicken Basil Panini. So, so good. This place is new and still a little unknown. I don't think it will stay that way.

ObHO_xK7bD4tRwHIAVe0TQ.text: Went here the other day with my family. Was a little nervous if s bar restaurant would be family friendly but was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere is great. The music they play is not too loud and there's different areas to sit depending on what they want. Huge menu. Our waitress Alexandria made us laugh and kids loved her. She knew the menu front to back and even had great recommendations for us.

oAL6RwFsXE637yeT65ShVQ.text: We had a wonderful server (Graham) and fantastic food! The deviled eggs and lobster Mac  #onpoint

eG7rP_JCIwlDomZ14k0GCw.text: Kathleen and I went here today for lunch. Neither of us had been.  The first impression was really sharp.  The decor and interior were very alluring.  I loved the lattice work with ivy and wood textures throughout the restaurant.   I also like the whimsy;  there is a wall with empty frames hanging on them.  Haha.  I liked the funky lighting and the bar. This is another warehouse type place, with exposed black pipes on the ceiling.  It is definitely probably more of a pub and bar than it is an eatery, but with that said, my garden salad with grilled salmon on it was very good.  Loved the apple cider viniagrette and its tang!   Kathleen ordered the lobster roll and let out a lot of happy sounds when she was eating it.  The menu wasn't huge, but was good for an upscale pub.  The service was good.  Several different people came by to check on us.  The music that was playing was from a generation ago, so we enjoyed it.  It was not softly in the background, but the sounds were dominantly wafting in the air!  This restaurant is across the parking lot from Tupelo Honey.  It's easy to find in the SouthEnd, right on South Blvd, just before East Blvd.  If you are out and about and want a cool atmosphere for a meal or a drink, this is a great choice.  You may want to hire the same interior designer to come add some funk to your home!

adl2dwntG9z3tr7Vf5YvpA.text: The service was sub par to say the least. It was very hot in the restaurant & our drinks were empty more than once. Not only were the waters empty, but the drinks we ordered came out wrong. The only salad ordered was missed & they would "probably take it off the bill". The manager made a bad joke about how hot it was... Needless to say, we won't be back.

BIGL5INQrqqaEKD3IOJ1pA.text: First thing I noticed was the service: the hostess was not friendly at all and barely acknowledged us. She barely spoke to us to let us know anything. As a past hostess & server myself, I definitely know that being opening and welcoming is extremely important in the customers experience. Our server was more kind but service was still slow. Now for the food: I had the basil chicken panini..pretty average. The chicken was somewhat cold for some of the bites I took which took away from a lot of it. It would have been much better if it wasn't cold. Fries with the sauce were pretty good though. Pretty average overall.

ysFtr8gZEvgb-8zEAZr-Xg.text: Wednesday: $5 wine and $8 charcuterie plate. Charcuterie plate was delicious. Also tried the seafood salad on top of hummus. Everything we had was great. Will definitely be Back to try some of the other salads that also look equally delicious.

YVObRIhXiaoEpGhp_uFdlw.text: Our server, John, reminds me of a well-read, absentee father.  When you speak to him, he speaks in a manner that leads you to believe he is knowledgeable and qualified. However, once you spend more time with him you see that he only comes around intermittently, and each attempt to fulfill the most basic of commitments, falls short.   I want to believe it's his first day. At least that would explain some of it. Or maybe he is racist and hates white people, but his complexion makes me think there is more to it.    Maybe he has never been to a restaurant himself. I mean, he doesn't seem to know refills are a thing, and he just brought me a light-pink colored sauce he seems to believes is ketchup. Who knows?  Food's good though. So, there's that.   Note: If you read that anything has "A-1 steak sauce" on it, it's a damn lie. Unless "A-1" is the lowest score on an in-house sauce ranking system. Perhaps this is Costco's (or some other chain's) generic interpretation of A-1, or it was expired. Or both. (Like several years gone.) Not sure, but "A-1 Steak Sauce", my good sir, it was not.   Also, if you come across any drink garnishes that are a deal-breaker for you, be prepared to bring your own or fight your server to the death for that skewer of olives. Up to you.

Qvzh-0qL-dKMFqCRxHo8Gw.text: If you're searching for a more intimate and exclusive setting, visit Dot Dot Dot in Park Rd Shopping Center.   Tucked underneath The Manchester, Room 1812 is not the speak-easy you've been searching for in Charlotte, and they bump club music like every other bar uptown. There was nothing unique, special, or secret about this place.   The basement was packed, and it was very difficult to get a single drink. We had one and then left. We went to Dot Dot Dot, they've done it right.

Ww2stMbWj4Y1uS0GvG5Ihw.text: I decided to have my fiance's 29th birthday here! We were visiting from out of town, I was able to make the reservation through open table which was awesome. The day of I had dropped off his cake and balloons and they stored it for me. When we arrived the tables were set and ready for us. I loved the fact they had a photo booth in entrance which just made this experience even better !!  It was a party of 17, we all didn't show up together. So I know that was kind of aggravating. But our servers did not seem bothered by that. (at some places you can read it all over their faces) Our servers where amazing !!! They took excellent care of each one of us.   We started with the spinach artichoke dip, firecracker shrimp (I was nervous based on the yelp reviews) , deviled eggs and fried pickles, all amazing appetizers!!!  Everyone enjoyed their food all great complaints. Just to name a few dishes my party recommend: Shrimp and grits, seafood risotto and lobster roll. We did have some problems with the filet they just couldn't get the temperatures right either it was too rare or too burnt. But again they were very helpful! Loved this restaurant!

jqOEEWSS07M3dPwBf2w-mg.text: Tried this place out for restaurant week.  Not very impressed.  8pm reservation and arrived at 8:05 (parking was a challenge as there were literally vehicles parking in the mulch in the rear/making their own spaces.  Anyway, arrived and was informed that no tables were ready and that it would be a 15 minute wait.  Told them we had reservations and they were able to procure a table after 5-7 minutes.  After sitting down we tried ordering a bottle of the Malbec only to learn that they did not carry that variety (yet??) settled on two glasses of Riesling. (I ordered the Greek salad-lobster/shrimp risotto with asparagus while my wife ordered the ginger salad with lamb chops. (Desserts to be ordered later)   Salads arrived quickly. No wine yet.  Apparently the bar was busy...though there were 6 empty tables to our right. My Greek salad had an abundance of hummus and grilled shrimp however no calamari while my wife's seemed to meet expectation.  After salad was done our wine arrived.  Generous sized pour, but the wine itself wasn't all that great.  Entrees arrived.  My risotto was advertised to have a lobster tail & claw along with shrimp....which if I added it all together probably had a totality about 4 shrimp and a half of a 1lb-lobster sized tail mixed in with the dish. A lot of cheese and risotto.  Sort of goopy without much presentation. Average taste for a dish with such lauded ingredients.  Asparagus was good.  The lamb chops with root vegetables my wife ordered were cooked perfectly and nicely presented on the wooden board.  Might have suggested the sauce be on the side so the root veggies and lamb didn't cook it. Yogurt based tzatziki sauce shouldn't be warmed up by the dish.  Pretty tasty though.     Waitress checked in a couple times mid meal and on the second occasion asked what we wanted for dessert while assuring us that the selections wouldn't arrive until after we completed our entrees.  About 1 minute later she arrived back to the table with them (peanut butter cake and truffle.  We sent her away with them since we were still mid-meal.  She came back three minutes later with them and left them at open spots on the table. For the dessert the cake had plenty of peanut butter flavor but seemed to not really have much else going for it aside from the moisture content.  The truffle was ok.  It's chocolate moose filling seemed flavorful but the nut/crumble base was lacking.     Though it was restaurant week I couldn't help but be disappointed in the service we received.  Our water glasses spent more time empty than full and we had to stack plates on the edge of our table while numerous wait staff passed by seemingly oblivious of our need to make room for what ended up being a pressured/rushed meal.  The kicker was we were adjacent to the kitchen and yet we had to still request water and for plates to be removed.  Not worth the $94 bill.      Having worked in hospitality at a 4-diamond resort I've come to appreciate quality food and service.  Neither seemed to be the case with this establishment.

kezp1VAnordp15jVugg-jQ.text: Meh. I hate to write this because I've been in with a happy hour bunch and appetizers are great! It's actually what made me go back with my family..... but that's where it turned for me - appetizers are still Uber tasty (deviled eggs & Brussels sprouts are noteworthy)! However, it's like something falls apart with the main courses. Hubs ordered prosciutto grilled cheese..... way TOO MUCH prosciutto and not enough cheese. Toast was thick and hearty but the sandwich was lackluster at best. My salad was a horrible disappointment - chuck full of what should have been great, but tomatoes were sad. They were multicolored (exciting) but mushy. And no, they were not stewed tomatoes, just BAD mushy. The taste was "fungus-y" to sum it up. I couldn't finish. Good thing o devoured those deviled eggs!!!   Bartender/server was a great personality, but I'd guess he's not everyone's millennial funky, trendy type and he could make some folks crazy. We enjoyed him enough, but he continued to refer to us as "friends" which made the table near us aggravated (they noted they were NOT his friends). I'll take kind servers over miserable versions any day. Sadly, this place has made the "do not return anytime soon" list.

sTylAHREb7ZbwvX_mwBRQw.text: On a whim some friends and I decided to attend a singles mixer at this location. Thankfully, the location was better than the event!! Happy hour bites are always a plus and I wasn't disappointed. I ordered the Spicy Dry Rub Wings, which were served with buffalo sauce, ranch or blue cheese, and celery. The buffalo sauce had a little heat and a hint of sweetness. I'm a fry junkie, so I got an order of those too!  These fries were hot and crispy, with the perfect amount of salt. Wednesday is also half priced wine, so it was a win...regardless of the horrible singles mixer!

wHrs6ikYCTq_r3dKUG8evg.text: This place is amazing! I ate there for brunch on a Saturday and the crowd was light.  On Saturdays and Sundays the brunch is from 10am-3pm. There are $5 mimosas and $10 bloody bulldogs all day! The happy hour is 4pm-7pm and has $5 appetizers.  There is a pub, dining room and patio area which are all very  nice with different feels. The dining area is cozy and intimate whereas the pub is more laid back. Prices vary. I ordered the grit cakes with eggs and it was absolutely amazing! Service was great. I literally have no complaints!

61W3MVUA2IHEowtBDduKmg.text: I came here with a party of about eight to celebrate a friend's birthday. It was rather late, but our servers were super nice. I really enjoy going out to eat & the server clearly has knowledge of the menu items to the extent that they have actually tried/had most of the food there.   I had some of the spinach & artichoke dip, spicy dry rub wings, and the black bean burger with seasoned fries.   The spinach and artichoke dip was super tasty. I liked the consistency of the dip & the pita chips that came with it. I'm typically not a fan of pita chips to be honest, but these were crispy & went really well with the dip.  The wings and the fries were ok. Nothing to really get excited about. The black bean burger itself was really good. You can tell a quality black bean burger by how much it falls apart. Now the bread that the black bean burger was in, I personally did not like.  It was dry and kind of cheap to me.

SDU7G75BApz0rtpotpZPzg.text: I have mixed feelings about this place. The service and appetizers were great! But I'm not sold on the entrees and the sides.   First, they have an amazing Happy Hour. All the best appetizers (according to our server) and I would have to agree are all $5.   I shared the Brussels and Bacon, Wings and Jalapeno Deviled eggs.   The Brussels and bacon are what dreams are made of! They are so savory and delicious. The wings have the BEST dipping sauce. I don't know what's in it but I loved it. And you really can't ever go wrong with deviled eggs not they definitely kicked it up a notch.   I would order all of these again and again.   But then it was time for the entree. I ordered a burger with a side of fried grits. The burger was a bit dry and didn't have any flavor. It was topped with cheese and bacon but still it was lacking something. And I can't even explain the fried grits. But they were not good. I asked for an extra side of sauce to see if that would help (it did not)  but there was no saving them.   So the sever that brought the extra sauce said that the fried grit are a hit for brunch. Because they come topped with a fried eggs and bacon. Honestly, I'm willing to try that.   So stay tuned for my brunch update. But for now they are just A-ok in my book.

Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings

uyR-uCuX0vVYAqqu6cSDZg.text: I originally only wanted to visit this place to have a couple of drinks, but I decided that I may as well eat something.   The bones (yes, bones) of this place provides a enough space to come hang out with a group of friends, while balancing the intimate feel if you want to just have a nice even with your beau. Also, if you're with a small/medium group... ask if you can sit in front of the fire place (if it's going) or outside on their patio on a nice day/evening. It was just two people in my party so we were able to grab a high-top table near the bar.   It took a little while for our waitress to approach us, but once we placed our drink orders everything else was seamless. I decided to try The Original burger (it was my one cheat day - go big or go home, right?) with a side of fries and I'm glad I did. First and foremost, I NEVER... I repeat... I NEVER eat all my fries! It was something about these that just hit the spot! The burger was cooked perfectly and I was grateful for their knives that cut it in half without chopping up my bun (knives used to cut burgers make a difference, LOL).   Overall, I will give them another try even if just for happy hour. Also, if you're there don't forget to ask your waiter(ess) to show you down to Room 1812 (their very own speakeasy). Keep in mind, that you'll need the password to get in... (hint: follow Room 1812 on IG, it's posted daily on their stories)! Hope to see you there!

photos.caption: Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area (fireplace seating available)

Photo of The Manchester - Charlotte, NC, United States. Their best kept secret...

lacyKfU3V--pUmc5zv2Oqw.text: Place: It was a very nice modern/old fashion resturant! Lots of decor. The speakeasy makes you feel like your back in the prohibition era. Loved every bit of it. Food and drink: slightly pricey. Spent close to $70 for 2 drinks each and a dessert and about the same on an app and 2 entrees. So it was a pricey night out. Drinks were tastey. They have a separate drink menu downstairs, but also serve the entire dessert menu in the speakeasy.  Service: our waitress was prompt. Refilled my water several times and continued to check on us. When we asked how to get downstairs the manager walked us around personally.  All and all an awesome little place. Will definitely return. A definite recommend.

6qkGCl5tMVY3c3hjxNL89w.text: This place is definitely a must if you are looking to do something fun and different. You can make a reservation but it's not required. We went on a Saturday and got a table immediately. The waiter was super nice, and the decoration is really nice. Don't expect that much out of the food it's not bad but it's not a meal that you think it's great! I would do some improvements in that aspect. The drinks were really good and strong, so take it slow.   The cool part of the experience is at the end of your meal ask your waiter that you would like to have dessert and after dinner drinks. They require a password were you can find on their instagram account, so make sure you check prior. They then take you downstairs to their speakeasy which I LOVED. It was dark and old school and the drinks were really good too!   I will definitely come back and recommend this place! I just would love for the menu to be a little more improved!!

SUtTkdNUn12SbqEIhdAo7w.text: Located across the parking lot from Tupelo Honey, we happenstanced here for brunch when the waiting time at Tupelo's was an hour. The lighting at Manchester's is uniquely elegant - the walls were of a slatted woodsy design that was offset by back panels of light. As much as I liked the lighting, the dining area was a bit dark for a brunch meal.  I opted the veggie frittata.  The kale salad atop the frittata added texture, flavor and color - perfect for a light protein breakfast. The star of my breakfast were the grits we ordered as a side. Omgosh....absolutely delicious! It was prepared as sticks, breaded and fried - Great compliment to the meal. We also ordered the monkey bread which was basically a cinnamon roll. It was a nice add-on nonetheless.  The service was very attentive. Looking forward to future visits to try other items on their menu - with a side of grits, of course.

xbPII5bazNqasKN0nI_IxQ.text: After seeing a post on CHARLOTTE Agenda, I was super excited when my coworkers suggested we try Manchester's for Lunch.   Entrance Walking in, at first I was saddened because they replaced The Liberty, a restaurant I enjoyed. But I was excited to try Manchester thanks to the recent post. At the entrance my coworker noticed their neon sign, "you are exactly where you need to be," and as we turned around there was a photobooth! How fun! Of course, we snapped and sent several pics then headed into the restaurant.  Dining Room We were immediately taken to our seat and walking in I noticed the changes for The Liberty but also a few decors that they kept. Sitting down our server greeted us and provided menus. The menu visibility was so hard to look at. It's a naturally dark restaurant, and the background was like a wood forest image with white lettering. Unfortunately, it was the first few bad things we noticed because we work in marketing.   Price The food is considerably overpriced especially for what they offer. You would think they offer a lunch menu or pricing, but they do not.  Food I ordered the firecracker shrimp, and I was not impressed at all. The flavor was good because they used so much breading, looks were very deceiving when the food came out. Myself and one of my coworkers ordered the chicken sandwich. It was so incredibly salty with every bite we took. The roof of our mouth had the feeling when you overeat salt, and it feels like you've burnt it. We barely ate a quarter of the burger, and she finished her fried, and I passed my fried grits to my other coworker. I was not impressed or pleased with anything. When the manager finally made his way to our table, I was not impressed with his comments. To quote him he said, "I'm sorry the chicken was salty today, but look at it this way you get a free meal!" apparently he completely missed the issue.  Staff The manager was at least 4feet from our table the only time he approached our table was when we had an issue with the food. Then entire time he stood at the kitchen looking into the dining room but did not move in our direction. Typically the manager will make there way around the restaurant, introduce their self and ask how the food is before there's a problem,  it this person. I will say I served was great! She consistently checked on us, and when we were hesitant to share how made our experience was with the food, she recognized it and immediately addressed the problem.   Leaving my friends and I stayed, the best part about this restaurant was the entrance. It's not likely we will be back for a while for the food, we were hoping it would be on point since it's new.

CjRGuFZvm0esD_xP3CVMug.text: I've been to The Manchester twice now - and both times were good, but not just great.  The venue and decor look great - really beautiful, welcoming space.  The food is good, but feels a bit pricey for the experiences we had.    I've had the charcuterie board, bacon jalapeno deviled eggs and (twice) greek seafood salad.   The greek seafood salad is on a bed of white bean hummus that is really tasty - and probably the reason I'll come back...  But, the service (both times) was SO SLOW and inattentive.  It seemed like the servers were either overbooked with tables or just not concerned with taking orders, filling drinks, checking on food, etc.  The food was brought out by people who didn't know what it was...truly, guessing what the food was to determine who had ordered it.  The second time, our appetizer didn't arrive until way after our entrees.    It's a decent experience, but not outstanding.

vyGOe6dgtvNDxJjA89ZhLw.text: Decided to come here for my birthday dinner with my wife, they were slow when we arrived and we were seated right away. We had the option to sit at the bar area, outside, or in main dining room. We opted for the bar area, once seated we were quickly greeted by our server who was friendly and she took our drink order.  We ordered the beer cheese pretzel twists for our appetizer, the standard portion comes 4 twists to an order, or 2 for the happy hour discounted portion. They were pretty good, but could have used a bit more salt, the cheese sauce was great though. For the main course I ordered the prime steak and cheese sandwich with fries for my side. The order came out in a reasonable time and was very good. The fries are battered and crispy and come with a side of some dipping sauce that is also pretty good.  After we ate we decided to pay a visit to the 1812 room, the hidden speakeasy that requires a password to get in. We were escorted there by the manager, since we didn't know where to go, he was very friendly.  It was very dim in there and had a decor reminiscent of the speakeasy days. The primary drink menu is specialty cocktails, but bottled/canned drinks are also available. We ordered dessert and drinks, both of which arrived quickly. The drink was stiff and the dessert was decent, we had the mousse madness, I was already full, so maybe I'd have enjoyed it more if I wasn't already stuffed.  We finished our dessert and relocated to one of the comfortable couches in the room to finish our cocktails, then we ordered another round of drinks while relaxing. It was a great experience and we'll likely come back again, even if only to visit the speakeasy. I found the drink prices to be a bit steep, but for the unique experience I suppose it's ok to splurge on occasion. I would give the place a try, access is easy and there is parking in the back of the building that is also shared with the business next door. The light rail station is also right behind the place, so that makes it easier to get there as well.

UcS6pWhjmI0RBi8PCCO9dw.text: I was curious to check this place out after hearing fairly good things about it after it opened. I believe they're still in their soft opening, but we enjoyed our happy hour here.   The bar area to the right is causal. They have a couch area and high top tables along with the outdoor patio. The more formal dining area is to the left. The inside will remind you of the Liberty if you went there before it closed. The decor is definitely different and very interesting.   We got the kale and brussel salad, the noble chicken sandwich, and the pork belly banh mi. I'm not a big salad fan, but that salad didn't even taste like a salad -- it was amazing. The banh mi was my favorite -- incredibly flavorful and delicious. The chicken sandwich was just ok.   Overall, I like what they've done with the place and thought the food was pretty good!

z2NZl2OBCO8ExcblgcUe1Q.text: FYI: Review of the "Speakeasy" portion of this place, not the "night club" portion that it turns into Friday and Saturdays after 10pm.  ABSOLUTELY LOVE this place! Such a cool little spot! Went here after work right when they opened for the day. Checked the password on their Instagram (room_1812) and buzzed right in. Dim lights, old black and white movies playing, old time bar music and the staff dressed to the nines of the time!  Now the drinks are more than enough to write home about! You know when you get the drink menu and there are no prices, you're probably going to be paying a pretty penny, but at the same time you expect to get a strong and delicious concoction... which they were spot on here! I asked the bartender what the best drink was/what he made the best and I ordered that. I can't remember the name but it had gin, raspberry, an egg white and vermouth. It was beautiful, strong and DELICIOUS!!! The friends I was with ordered a mojito and gin gimlet, both were delicious as well!  Definitely a fun atmosphere during the Speakeasy Hours! Interested to see it during the "DJ/club" hours, as currently the reviews aren't great, but it's only been opened a week so hopefully it gets better and I have something good to report back with. Until then, go get your speakeasy on folks!

y7Fvn8obif91bffRfvtcVg.text: This is a pretty cool place that's hasn't been open that long. There is a shared parking lot on the back of the restaurant. If you don't drive the metro literally has a stop behind the parking lot! Upon entering they have a foyer area where you can take a selfie and the other side with a positive quite about your presence and flowers. They have indoor and outdoor seating. If you choose to sit outside they have fans. I choose to sit at the bar after asking about specials. From 4-7 they have a limited menu of discounted food items. You can also order from the main menu too. David was an awesome bartender and I told him to create something I could enjoy. No pressure right?! Lol well he did a great job. It was called the " Vanishing Tiffany" as he said because I was going to make it vanish and I did. The wings were tasty the pretzel was fresh... I didn't care for their mustard sauce that came with the pretzel. The deviled eggs with jalapenos are dangerous. Make sure you clear your plans after eating those you can clean out a room.  The plates on the table weren't clean, but we were able to find some clean ones on the empty table next to us.  I got the chicken pesto panini which was filling and flavorful. It was noted to be a popular item on the menu. The fries were crispy and good.  I was way too full for desert. I would like to return again to try some different dishes at another time frame. Overall it was a pleasant experience. Enjoy!

LnCUOpsU1HvWa7ocpdfn4w.text: I came here twice in one week, so let's talk about each experience separately. The first visit, I had a decent experience. They have $5 apps before 7PM and they have a good selection of items. I liked the deviled eggs, wings, and brussel sprouts the best. They were all very good. The eggs were my favorite. The wings come with a delicious sauce. I ordered the goat cheese salad for an entree and was sadly disappointed. The goat cheese was so yummy, it's one of my favorites. The onion straws on top were disgusting. I also asked for no craisins, but they put them on anyway. The waiter said they made the onions in house every AM. Gross. They were stale tasting and tough. They ruined the rest of the salad. It also needs to have more beets. The butternut squash soup was ok, but actually too sweet, even for me. The waiter was so nice. He was one of the best I've had in awhile. I have no service complaints.   The second visit was a late night bite. We had artichoke dip, pretzels, and hummus. All disgusting!!!!!!!!!  I mean, disgusting. The pretzels were too large and stale tasting. The artichoke dip was the worse flavor I've ever tasted in my life. The hummus was extremely bland, flavorless. The pita chips were the soft ones and they had a horrific aftertaste. Again, the service was good. They have some great people working for them, but the food needs some help.  I would not recommend eating here. Or, if you do: wings, sprouts, and eggs only.

uurjE-yX9oEhkWRXYb1Q5g.text: The food is horrible and the service is even worse. I had high expansions for this place but it lacks management. Completely unorganized, late food times and an all around crap bar staff. Do yourself a favor and skip on this place.

uRIKAvUAByYcMAA33Ap5uA.text: Nice at atmosphere but it's ruined by the service.   I wait for 15 minutes at the bar to get a drink.  I think that's long but I understand that craft cocktails take time to make.  When the bartender finally gets to me, I order an old fashioned.  The bartender tells me that they don't serve craft cocktails after 11.00 pm and I that need to order a mixed drink ..... The current time was 10.55 pm.  The bar staff obviously isn't very good and it ruins what could be a great place.

URngKaZXMIjG3QKlDxzwhA.text: My first experience here was a few weeks ago when my husband and I stopped in for a drink and appy at the bar. We had the spinach/artichoke dip, which was fantastic. The bartender was super nice. When we went for dinner with a couple friends last week, we had a parallel universe experience. The waitress had a terrible attitude and was very unfriendly. The service was erratic. I had ordered a beer and got it when we were almost through - she had probably forgotten, and it wasn't even busy. We were the only ones in the back room, which is beautiful by the way. I had the fish and chips, which I wouldn't get again because the fish was thick and had a weird consistency, like it had been frozen for a long time. Our friends were similarly put off by the bad service and surprising lack of quality in the food. It's also expensive for pub food, but you see that a lot in Charlotte. My friends said they would not go back. I would consider going back, but hope to get a waitress who didn't act like she hated waiting on us. That is just uncomfortable. Anyway, I try to give new places a second chance because they could just be ironing out the wrinkles.

YyOxI0O1XUO0-uy51rk0pw.text: Love the food, the atmosphere, and the detail oriented servers. The manager even took the time to stop by our table and ask how our experience was. Ive been here 3 times since they opened specifically for the food but everything else has been amazing. Also love the photo booth at the entrance!!

SRLCy-YGb_sMxcfUrfnVFA.text: Now I know what I've  been doing wrong in Charlotte... If you're visiting  Charlotte, RUN to the Manchester, experience the dining at the bar and then tickle down to room 1812 in the basement.  This is a hidden gem... THE HIDDEN GEM of the city. Go see the lively crowd, have a couple Corpse Reviver 2's and hear all about the local speakeasy scene.  I came to the Manch tonight, had an incredible experience and ventured downstairs through the walled subdivision.  Enter if you dare. But be aware, there's entry to the 5 other local realms dow there.   Peace, love.  Enjoi

J4X_Kc_zgy0wttWao9VQKQ.text: Great vibe, cozy setting. Service was fantastic. I had the Clover Club cocktail, the smoked old fashioned is a must try. Great food and desserts... will definitely be back

UgHjX3z-U8PmikQGnCaM0w.text: Went on Sunday to relax and watch some basketball after work. This was the perfect place for that. Not overly crowded. Great drinks and Amber S. provided great service.

6-NNUXSYDCvsMXT8DuoRtg.text: Not sure you can get anymore authentic! Dark setting, swing band music, flapper girl cocktail server and old school decor! I thought the place was really amazing and the password needed to get in from the back alley was very cool!

Gpx8WQEIxF3Z-COarD6LgQ.text: I had an amazing experience at this place for a few different reasons. 1) The brunch food was excellent!  And I run a brunch group, so I'm picky.  We had 14 people in our party, many of whom ordered different dishes, and everyone collectively agreed that it was fantastic.  2) The manager, Mike, went above and beyond to take care of our party.  He could not have been more personable  and helpful. 3) The staff was fantastic as well, and took care of the large party seamlessly.  They were friendly, efficient, brought out everything pretty quickly for such a large group, and it was all still hot.  And gave us separate checks - none of which were incorrect.  I really appreciate good service like that.  4) The general manager, Dan, was also awesome - and gave us a tour of Room 1812 downstairs (which I HIGHLY recommend for anyone who appreciates a pretty authentic speakeasy with top quality cocktails).  I'll definitely be going back soon.

xQ5g5Bmaxri8R7i4HT4qdw.text: I never write reviews ever but my experience last night with extremely disappointing. While I understand the restaurant is pretty new and still figuring everything out, we experienced many issues. The bar was backed up so by the time all 7 of us received our drinks, the ice was already melted making the drinks very watered down. 2 of the 7 girls at my table received their entrees 20 minutes after the other 5. Several of the meals were cold and/or weren't nearly as described as on the menu (ex. Seafood Greek Salad was basically squid and shrimp on top of a heaping of hummus - yuck). The salads were definitely overpriced for what you actually received. We also experienced issues with bills - some were charged for drinks and appetizer, others weren't at all. The waitress was very sweet but didn't seem to want to adjust the bills accordingly or comp the items she said would be. What was planned to be a 1.5 hr (max) dinner, took at least 2.5 hrs due to the very slow service and many issues we experienced. Overall, extremely disappointed. Sadly would not recommend. The spinach artichoke dip with pita bread, however, was the only thing I'd recommend about my experience there.
